meanings.definition: The quality of being extremely bad or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: The execrableness of the situation left everyone feeling miserable.
meanings.sent2: The execrableness of the food made me lose my appetite.
meanings.sent3: Despite the execrableness of the weather, we managed to have a good time indoors.
meanings.sent4: The execrableness of the news hit me like a ton of bricks.
meanings.sent5: The execrableness of the smell was so overpowering that I had to leave the room.

meanings.definition: Deserving to be detested or abhorred.
meanings.sent1: The movie was so execrable that I walked out of the theater.
meanings.sent2: The criminal's execrable actions shocked the entire community.
meanings.sent3: His execrable sense of humor always manages to make me laugh.
meanings.sent4: The execrable behavior of the bullies made the school a hostile place.
meanings.sent5: The execrable taste of the medicine made it hard to swallow.
